t: Amazon targets multiple bad actors in novel lawsuit, further protecting selling partners from fraud
s: March 30, 2023 - Amazon has filed three lawsuits against bad actors that pretended to be legitimate copyright owners in an attempt to remove products from the Amazon Store.

t: FTC Sues Amazon for Illegally Maintaining Monopoly Power | Federal Trade Commission

t: Amazon copied products and rigged search results to promote its own brands, documents show | Reuters
s: October 13, 2021 - Amazon.com Inc has been repeatedly accused of knocking off products it sells on its website and of exploiting its vast trove of internal data to promote its own merchandise at the expense of other sellers. The company has denied the accusations.

t: Amazon sued by FTC and 17 states over allegations it inflates online prices and overcharges sellers | AP News
s: September 27, 2023 - The Federal Trade Commission and 17 state attorneys general have filed an antitrust lawsuit against Amazon. They allege the e-commerce behemoth uses its position in the marketplace to inflate prices on and off Amazon, overcharge sellers and stifle competition.

t: Amazon sellers say they made a good living — until Amazon figured it out
s: October 11, 2023 - Amazon faces a landmark federal lawsuit that accuses it of squeezing independent sellers like this Michigan company, Top Shelf Brands, which used to sell hair and beauty products on the platform. In 2022, the company stopped operating and filed for bankruptcy.

t: Attorney General Mayes Sues Amazon for Unfair and Deceptive Practices | Arizona Attorney General
s: PHOENIX – Attorney General Kris Mayes today announced that Arizona has sued Amazon, accusing the online giant of unfair and deceptive business practices under the Arizona Consumer Fraud Act and the Arizona Uniform State Antitrust Act.
